channel.title: What is a trojan?
channel.description: I went to a site and macafee detected a trojan.. what is this?

item.title: What is a trojan?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I’ll tell ye a little story of Troy.

Troy was the legendary city of the Trojan War. (You can see models of the Trojan Horse in Greece). Long story short, the Greeks couldn’t get past Troy’s walls so they built a big ass wooden horse, and witch I believe was Achillies idea, and a few people hid in it, the Trojans thought it was a gift from the god, took it into their compound and at night, the Greeks got out, opened the gate and the hidden Greek army’s came in.

More info can be found here, here, here and finally, here.

If you read that, and you understood then you don’t need to read this, but if you didn’t understand, I would think the main purpose of a trojan virus would be to make you download a seemingly non-harmful program(the wooden horse full of people), once there, allow connections in(the people getting out and opening the gates).

Read full topic

item.title: What is a trojan?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Frell:

Web clients run thereselves… but a thing did come up and say “run” and it said unknown publisher and i said cancel

As long as you don’t accept that you will be fine, because until you accept it the webclient can’t touch anything on your computer.

Read full topic

item.title: What is a trojan?
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

lawl, this isnt IRC which means it isn’t time to spam

and

[quote=“therealjdb, post:6, topic:81083”][quote author=Frell link=topic=119166.msg1170034#msg1170034 date=1176779856]
Does macafee stop it from installing itself?
[/quote]
I’m not sure as I don’t use macafree but it should’ve prompted you when you tried to run the infected file, as long as you don’t run that file and remove it right away you should be safe. Now if you ran the file already and your computer is already infected I’d recommend scanning your computer completely with Ad-aware or something of the sort to be on the safe side.[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: What is a trojan?
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

Frell:

Does macafee stop it from installing itself?

I’m not sure as I don’t use macafree but it should’ve prompted you when you tried to run the infected file, as long as you don’t run that file and remove it right away you should be safe. Now if you ran the file already and your computer is already infected I’d recommend scanning your computer completely with Ad-aware or something of the sort to be on the safe side.

Read full topic

item.title: What is a trojan?
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Trojan horse (computing)

In computing, a Trojan horse, or Trojan, is any malware which misleads users of its true intent. The term is derived from the Ancient Greek story of the deceptive wooden horse that led to the fall of the city of Troy. Trojans are generally spread by some form of social engineering, for example where a user is duped into executing an e-mail attachment disguised to appear not suspicious, (e.g., a routine form to be filled in), or by clicking on some fake advertisement on social media or anywhere...

In the context of computer software, a Trojan horse is a program that unlike a virus contains or installs a malicious program (sometimes called the payload or 'trojan'). The term is derived from the classical myth of the Trojan Horse. Trojan horses may appear to be useful or interesting programs (or at the very least harmless) to an unsuspecting user, but are actually harmful when executed. (See Social engineering.)

Often the term is shortened to simply trojan, even though this turns the adjective into a noun.

There are two common types of Trojan horses. One is otherwise useful software that has been corrupted by a hacker inserting malicious code that executes while the program is used. Examples include various implementations of weather alerting programs, computer clock setting software, and peer to peer file sharing utilities. The other type is a standalone program that masquerades as something else, like a game or image file, in order to trick the user into some misdirected complicity that is needed to carry out the program’s objectives.

Trojan horse programs cannot operate autonomously, in contrast to some other types of malware, like viruses or worms. Just as the Greeks needed the Trojans to bring the horse inside for their plan to work, Trojan horse programs depend on actions by the intended victims. As such, if trojans replicate and even distribute themselves, each new victim must run the program/trojan. Therefore their virulence is of a different nature, depending on successful implementation of social engineering concepts rather than flaws in a computer system’s security design or configuration.

However there is another meaning for the term ‘Trojan Horse’ in the field of computer architecture. Here it basically represents any piece of User Code which makes the Kernel Code access anything it would not have been able to access itself in the first place (i.e making the OS do something it wasn’t supposed to be doing). Such security loopholes are called Trojan Horses.

It’s a type of virus basically see above.

Read full topic
